titles.title: LINE Act of 2015
Lines Interfere with National Elections Act of 2015
A bill to amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to ensure that voters in elections for Federal office do not wait in long lines in order to vote.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

bill.summary:
1/21/2015--Introduced. Lines Interfere with National Elections Act of 2015 or the LINE Act of 2015
Amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to require each jurisdiction where a substantial number of voters waited more than 30 minutes to cast a vote in the federal election held on November 6, 2012, or any federal election held after that date, to comply with a state remedial plan to minimize voter waiting times.
